ADAPTIVE SHIELDING.name: 自适应屏蔽
ADAPTIVE SHIELDING.effect: 每轮首次在防御网中的盟友受伤害时，防御网内所有盟友获得对该类型伤害抗性。该持续到宙斯盾下一回合结束。

ADAPT/EVADE/DISENGAGE.name: 适应/规避/脱离
ADAPT/EVADE/DISENGAGE.effect: 马蜂获得对擒拿的免疫且始终忽视交战。

ADHESIVE SECRETIONS.name: 黏着分泌物
ADHESIVE SECRETIONS.effect: 每回合首个被怪形伤害的角色必须通过工程豁免否则缓慢。该效果会持续到目标恢复 HP 或场景结束。

AEGIS.flavor: 宙斯盾原型机被用来驻守阵地、支持盟友和压制敌人。在科摩罗（Comorrand）行动中，卡拉金驾驶员麦克伦南（MacLennan）家族的格洛丽亚（Gloria）女士首次使用它并取得显著效果。宙斯盾以其强大防御措施而闻名。其驾驶员可熟练运用传统工具至尖端技术，将最小屏障化为坚固堡垒。
AEGIS.name: 宙斯盾
AEGIS.tactics: 宙斯盾是坚固的防御支援单位。覆盖尽可能多盟友的防御网最为有效，因它们很难重新部署。再生护盾也保护宙斯盾免受移动性降低的影响。

AGGRESSION.name: 好斗
AGGRESSION.effect: 每轮受到第一次伤害后，狂战士必须立即用链斧攻击邻近的任意角色——无论敌友。

ARGUS ARMOR.effect: 超体拥有 6 装甲。每次掷骰结构伤害或过热检定，它们失去 2 装甲，最低 0。
ARGUS ARMOR.name: 阿耳戈斯装甲

ARSENAL.name: 军火库
ARSENAL.effect:
工程师使用可部署炮塔时，可为其炮塔选择以下一种改造：
  • ·狱火：炮塔攻击变成锥形 3，2/3/4 燃烧伤害。
  • ·地狱风暴：炮塔攻击变成射程 15，溅射 1，2/3/4 爆炸。
  • ·猎人：炮塔攻击获得可靠 1。
  • ·蓄势待发：炮塔或工程师摧毁时，炮塔在爆发 1 爆炸。受影响区域内角色必须通过敏捷豁免否则受到 7/9/11 爆炸伤害。

Artificial.name: 人工
Artificial.effect: 该特征只能被用于生物怖物。怖物不再拥有生物标签，并且获得 6 热度。

ASSASSIN’S MARK.name: 暗杀者标记
ASSASSIN’S MARK.effect:
暗杀者选择视线内一个角色。直到场景结束前使用以下效果：
  • ·对目标伤害有抗性。
  • ·对该目标造成的伤害无法减免。
  • ·在该目标强制的所有豁免中获得+1 准度。

暗杀者只有当前目标被摧毁后才能选择新目标。

ASSAULT ARMOR.name: 突击装甲
ASSAULT ARMOR.effect: 复仇者对射程 3 以内的所有伤害有抗性。

AUTO-TARGETING.effect: 突击手在攻击时忽略掩护，尽管仍需要视线。
AUTO-TARGETING.name: 自动锁定

Automated Battlefield Awareness Node.name: 自动战斗感知节点
Automated Battlefield Awareness Node.effect:
特种部队获得战斗感知反应，可以在一轮中使用无限次。这个系统每场战斗只能由一个特种部队使用。
战斗感知
触发： 视线射程 8 内的特种部队盟友角色将掷骰豁免。
效果： 他们在掷任意骰前自动成功豁免。

AVALANCHE CHARGE.name: 雪崩冲锋
AVALANCHE CHARGE.effect: 狂战士沿着直线移动与速度相等的空间，忽略反应和交战，然后用链斧攻击随机邻近角色——无论敌友。

BARRICADE.flavor: 维尔德系统公司（Veld Systems）守护者五型（（Keeper Pattern 5）是种常见卫兵机甲，因其在拉玛之歌战役（Sing Rama Sing）中的出色表现而名声大噪。战役中，炽天使连队的奥黛丽·雷默斯（Audrey Reimaus）用守护者 5 型独自保护了拉玛城主天梯塔的安全，从而保证城市居民疏散通道。
BARRICADE.tactics: 需封锁高机动目标那么路障是把好手。它们可以使用便携打印机为盟友制造硬性掩护，或阻止近战机甲通过区域。
BARRICADE.name: 路障

BLIND.name: 盲目术
BLIND.effect: 女巫对感应内一个角色进行科技攻击。成功则目标在下一回合结束前只对邻近空间有视线。

BLIP.name: 信标光点
BLIP.effect: 蜃楼可让一个盟友角色向任意方向瞬间移动 5 空间。
BLIP.trigger: 一个敌对角色在视线内执行动作。

BOLSTER NETWORK.name: 激励广播
BOLSTER NETWORK.effect: 视线内所有盟友角色（指挥官除外）系统豁免+1准度，对其进行的科技攻击+1 难度。

BOMBARD.name: 投弹者
BOMBARD.tactics: 投弹者是种长距离炮击机甲，其设计目的用来惩戒那些依靠邻近优势紧密阵型的角色他们在近距离时相对脆弱，但在一段距离后对困境有承受力，所以把他们放远一点，以最大化他们的效力。投弹者的撼地炮弹在阻止敌人移动和提供掩护方面效果很好，但也会伤害盟友。
BOMBARD.flavor: 阿尔塔全域弹道公司（Alta All-Theater Ballistics）原型机投弹者底盘及其授权仿品是全银河系中普遍存在的闪光点。建立在长期运行部署持久作战基础，投弹者机甲是为快速部署炮兵至战区的武装部队提供的可行性解决方案。根据此类参数配置的底盘通常位于前线后方数英里设防位置；一种特别非对称部署策略包括在战区上空安置投弹者组——通常是在本地卫星、人工捕获至稳定轨道的天然卫星或专门建造的轨道平台上。从它们的有利位置，炮组可向下方天体倾泻炮弹而远离战斗危险。

BOMBING BAY.name: 轰炸区
BOMBING BAY.effect: 若王牌在移动或推进时处于飞行，他们可以向飞行路径下方或邻近的一个角色投掷炸弹。这会造成必须至少与目标占据 1 空间重叠的溅射 1 爆炸。受影响区域内角色必须通过敏捷豁免否则受到 6/8/10 爆炸伤害并伏卧。

BULWARK MODS.name: 堡垒模块
BULWARK MODS.effect: 路障忽略困难地形和危险地形。

Bulwark Mods.name: 堡垒模块
Bulwark Mods.effect: 特种部队忽略困难和危险地形。

BUNKER BUSTER.name: 掩体粉碎机
BUNKER BUSTER.effect: 射石加农炮对受影响区域内物品和地形造成10/15/20AP 爆炸伤害，无需掷骰。

CONSUME SHROUD.name: 烧竭护罩
CONSUME SHROUD.effect: 潜伏者消耗一个他们所在或邻近的护罩区域，清除所有状况，获得护盾 4/6/8，然后移动与速度相等的空间。他们无法消耗他们在同一回合中创建的护罩区域。

CRUSH TARGETING.name: 挤压目标
CRUSH TARGETING.effect: 视线感应内的一个角色攻击歌利亚外其他角色时+3 难度，直到歌利亚下一回合开始。

DEADLIEST GAME.name: 致命游戏
DEADLIEST GAME.effect: 怪形至少有一个可选突变。

DEADLY.name: 致命
DEADLY.effect: 复仇者会心一击+1d6 动能伤害。

DEFENSIVE SHROUD.name: 防御护罩
DEFENSIVE SHROUD.effect: 它会创建一个以它所在位置为中心的护罩区域，即使它已有三个激活区域。
DEFENSIVE SHROUD.trigger: 潜伏者受到伤害或热度。

DET SPIKE.effect: 视线射程5内最多3个角色必须通过系统豁免否则一枚引爆钉刺将附加在其身上。播种机下一回合开始，所有引爆钉刺都将引爆，产生爆发 1 爆炸，对所有受影响角色造成 3/5/7 爆炸伤害。若受影响区域重叠，角色将从多个钉刺来源受到多个伤害。
DET SPIKE.name: 引爆钉刺

DEVASTATOR.name: 毁灭
DEVASTATOR.effect: 1/轮，超体发动一次成功的攻击时，视线内所有角色受到 2/4/6 动能，能量或爆炸伤害。

DISPERSAL SHIELD.name: 散列护盾
DISPERSAL SHIELD.effect: 司铎释放微型无人机聚集在附近机甲周围提供保护。司铎或处于感应内的一个盟友将从之后的 1d3 次攻击中获得对伤害和热度的抗性。该效果不会叠加。

DRAG DOWN.name: 拖下水
DRAG DOWN.effect: 路障对感应中的一个角色进行科技攻击。若成功，目标每主动移动 1 空间就会造成 2AP 能量伤害直到对方下一回合结束。

DRONE BARRAGE.name: 雄蜂攻势
DRONE BARRAGE.effect: 蜂巢对感应内一个角色进行科技攻击。成功则目标将选择其一：对方固定并受损直到下一回合结束，或立即朝蜂巢所选方向移动 5 空间。该移动忽略交战和反应。

DRUM SHOTGUN.name: 鼓轮霰弹枪
DRUM SHOTGUN.effect: T2 时，该武器可一次攻击两次，目标可以是同一个角色，也可以是两个不同角色。T3 时，它可以一次攻击三次。

DUCK.name: 闪避
DUCK.effect: 该攻击失败，且神行客获得对所有伤害抗性直到回合结束。
DUCK.trigger: 超过射程 8 的远程攻击将击中神行客。

EFFICIENT KILLER.effect: 佣兵攻击 2 结构或以下角色获得+1 准度和 AP。
EFFICIENT KILLER.name: 高效杀手

ELECTRIFIED BOLA.name: 导电投石索
ELECTRIFIED BOLA.effect: 射程 10 内的飞行角色必须通过敏捷豁免。若失败则立即降落并固定直到对方下一回合结束。此效果算没有伤害的坠落。

ELECTRIFIED LASSO.name: 导电套索
ELECTRIFIED LASSO.effect: 在视线射程 5 内的一个角色必须通过机体豁免。失败则会被拉到尽可能靠近甲胄骑兵的位置；若对方至邻近，则甲胄骑兵自动擒拿对方。

ELECTRO-NANITE CLOUD.name: 电镀纳米云
ELECTRO-NANITE CLOUD.effect: 蜂巢射程3内敌方角色在其回合开始时受到2燃烧伤害；此外直到对方离开射程 3，否则进行所有系统检定和豁免以及所有科技攻击+1/2/3 难度。

EMP Pulse.name: EMP 脉冲
EMP Pulse.effect:
触发：水蛭擒拿时受到外部来源的伤害或热度。

效果：爆发 2 内敌对角色必须通过系统豁免，否则受扰直到他们下一回合结束。

ENDLESS RAIN.name: 无尽之雨
ENDLESS RAIN.effect: 祈雨师为标枪火箭弹选择 6 空间，而非 3。

ENGINEER.name: 工程师
ENGINEER.flavor: 各种类型的本地化工程师级机甲在全银河系中都颇为常见，专属于它们自身所运作的天体或舞台。工程师作为一种原型早已存在，但直到拉斯·萨姆拉兵工厂公务主管科里达·伊索尔德-诺莱（CorridaIsolde-Nollet）提出了完整的设计原则，它才在很大程度上被定义。在所有情况下，工程师的任务都呈一致性：保卫、维护、安全。工程师在战线中部或后方的最佳作战位置，协调重要阵地的防御，监督所有作战资产的全面部署。记住：若你不能了解敌人，你就会输。
ENGINEER.tactics: 工程师的可部署炮塔使他们成为强大的武力倍增器，他们可以每回合部署一个。若敌人不能快速对付工程师炮塔，他们的潜在危害迅速飙升——当他们瞄准带有工程师标记的角色时更是如此。没有工程师标记，炮塔会攻击最近目标，玩家可以借此来控制谁受到伤害。

ENGINEER’S MARK.name: 工程师标记
ENGINEER’S MARK.effect: 直到工程师下一回合结束，工程师可部署炮塔将攻击它们选择的目标（在射程内），而不是攻击最近的敌方角色。

ENTHRONE.name: 登基
ENTHRONE.effect: 怨恨者被固定并激活爆裂防御盾。任何对怨恨者或其邻近盟友进行远程或近战攻击的角色在掷骰前受到 3AP 能量伤害。该效果持续怨恨者下一回合结束，或以快速动作结束该效果。

ENTRENCHED.name: 盘踞
ENTRENCHED.effect: 怨恨者免疫敌对角色强迫的非自主移动。

EXOTIC.description: 即使在这充满奇迹的银河系中，异种也是怪异而危险的敌人。一些具备独特技术，某些尚不适用于更宽泛的银河系，有些使用者更新至现代的古老武器样式，而另一些则携带着或采用着完全不符合联盟原则的装备或战术。
EXOTIC.name: 异种

EXOTIC SYSTEMS.name: 异种系统
EXOTIC SYSTEMS.effect: 异种在异种系统和特征表中最多可以选择两项。

EXPLOSIVE JET.name: 爆炸性喷口
EXPLOSIVE JET.effect: 爆发 2 以内的敌人必须通过机体豁免否则击退至区域外并伏卧。然后纵火狂向任意方向飞行 5 空间，但必须在完成该动作后着陆。

EXPLOSIVE KNIVES.name: 爆裂匕首
EXPLOSIVE KNIVES.effect: 暗杀者消耗1充能向射程3内一个角色投掷爆裂匕首，远程攻击目标+2/+4/+6。命中则匕首嵌入目标并在对方下一回合结束时爆炸，爆发 1 内造成 6/8/10 爆炸伤害。

FADE GENERATOR.name: 褪色生成器
FADE GENERATOR.effect: 操作员回合结束时会隐形直到下一回合开始。若受到伤害或进行反应，该状况立即停止。

Fade Reactor.name: 褪色炉
Fade Reactor.effect: 选择一个被水蛭擒拿的角色：水蛭和目标隐形直到水蛭下一回合开始。

FAVORS OWED.name: 人情债
FAVORS OWED.effect: 雇佣兵请求帮助：轨道或炮火轰炸，目标是视线射程 30 内的溅射 2。受影响区域内的角色必须通过敏捷豁免否则受到 6/8/12 爆炸伤害并伏卧。成功则伤害减半不会伏卧。

FEEDBACK SHIELD.effect: 怨恨者视线射程 5 内选择一个盟友角色。任何成功伤害该角色的角色会立即受扰直到他们下一回合结束。该效果持续到被触发，或场景结束。
FEEDBACK SHIELD.name: 反馈护盾

FEIGN DEATH.name: 假死
FEIGN DEATH.effect: 老兵每场战斗中被摧毁时，他们实际在假死——他们看起来被摧毁了，但还剩 1HP。邻近老兵的角色可通过系统检定或驾驶员技能检定来揭示；否则老兵会一直被忽视直到对方移动或执行动作。

FIREBREAK SHIELD.name: 防火带盾
FIREBREAK SHIELD.effect: 纵火狂回合结束时，视线内其中末端 1 空间与纵火狂邻近的自由空间创造出高 4 空间的线形 4 能量护盾。它不会阻挡视线，但提供软性掩护；当攻击一个受益于掩体的角色时，掷骰 1d6 出 4+视为未命中。这将持续到纵火狂下一回合开始，或纵火狂移动或晕眩。它无法和隐形叠用。

First On, Last Off.name: 冲锋在前，撤退在后
First On, Last Off.effect: 以反应对海军陆战队进行攻击时（如守望）获得+1难度。

FLAK CANNON.name: 高射加农炮
FLAK CANNON.effect: 该武器对飞行目标攻击有+2 准度。

FLAMETHROWER.name: 火焰喷射器
FLAMETHROWER.effect: 该武器对已燃烧的角色造成双倍燃烧。

FLARE DRONE.name: 耀斑无人机
FLARE DRONE.effect:
耀斑无人机（尺寸 1/2，HP10/20/30，闪避 10，电子防御 10，标签：无人机）
该无人机可被部署到视线射程 25 空间，在那里盘旋并开始向爆发 2 区域投射强光。受影响区域内所有角色，包括那些移动到该区域或在区域内开始其回合的角色将失去隐形和匿迹，且无法在该区域内躲藏或隐形。此外，投弹者对受影响区域内角色的攻击+1 准度。
无人机会承受投弹者攻击的伤害，投弹者一次只能部署一架无人机；若部署新的无人机，则旧的会解体。

FLIER.name: FLIER
FLIER.effect: The Ship moves normally in zero-g environments. In-atmosphere, it hovers. It gains Immunity to Immobilized, Stunned and Prone.

FOLLOWER COUNT.name: FOLLOWER COUNT
FOLLOWER COUNT.effect: The Breacher makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the Breacher gains +{1/2/3} Accuracy on all attacks against their target, and may Boost once per turn as a free action so long as it moves them directly towards their target. This lasts until either character is destroyed and cannot be changed to a new target.

FORTRESS.name: FORTRESS
FORTRESS.effect: The Operator gains +3 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +3 difficulty.

FRACTAL ASSAULT.name: FRACTAL ASSAULT
FRACTAL ASSAULT.effect: The attacker makes a System save. If it fails, they’re Stunned until the end of their next turn.
FRACTAL ASSAULT.trigger: A character linked by Investiture takes damage.

FRIENDLY INTERDICTION.name: FRIENDLY INTERDICTION
FRIENDLY INTERDICTION.effect: The Bastion and one allied character adjacent to it gain Resistance to all damage dealt by one character within line of sight. The Bastion may choose a new allied character or target as a protocol. The allied character loses Resistance if they break adjacency.

Full-Spectrum Sensor Suite.name: Full-Spectrum Sensor Suite
Full-Spectrum Sensor Suite.effect: The Spec Ops may Lock On as a protocol. Whenever an allied Spec Ops character within Range 10 consumes any Lock On, their attack is not affected by cover. This system can only be taken by one Spec Ops per combat.

Full-Tracked.effect: The MBT must always move in a straight line, although it can move and Boost in separate directions. Additionally, the MBT can't climb, swim, manipulate objects, or make melee attacks other than Ram, but it ignores difficult terrain and has Immunity to Prone.
Full-Tracked.name: Full-Tracked

GLITCH SCANNERS.name: GLITCH SCANNERS
GLITCH SCANNERS.effect:
The Mirage’s advanced electronic countermeasures play havoc with enemy systems, causing them to register false positives on the battlefield. They may teleport up to two allied characters within Sensors, moving them 5 spaces in any direction – revealing their “true” locations. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.
The Mirage also gains the Blip reaction.

GOLIATH.tactics: Goliaths are relatively mobile defenders that can bring enemies to them. With Crush Targeting, Goliaths force dangerous enemies to focus attacks on them; all it needs is line of sight, allowing Goliaths to target even fast or hard-to-hit characters. The prodigious size of Goliaths also lets them provide cover for their allies.
GOLIATH.name: 歌利亚
GOLIATH.flavor:
Along the Sierra Madre Line – the eighth ring of territory out from Cradle – the Dangun frame is a familiar sight. Manufactured by Park Armored Systems and popularized by the Dagger Squadron mercenary company, the Dangun is popular for its toughness, kinetic damage-trade ability, and reliable all-theater performance. The Dangun is a mech to build strike forces around – a Goliath-class frame capable of mounting powerful magtech, with a design that’s tough to counter in kinetic damage combat.
With a number of small fleet contracts in its portfolio, Park Armored Systems is a manufacturer worth keeping an eye on; indeed, Harrison Armory has taken particular notice, and omninet rumors suggest a possible partnership in the near future.

GOT YOUR BACK.name: GOT YOUR BACK
GOT YOUR BACK.effect: The Archer may attack that character.
GOT YOUR BACK.trigger: A character in the area makes an attack.

GRASPING CLAWS.name: GRASPING CLAWS
GRASPING CLAWS.effect: The Monstrosity gains +1 Accuracy to Grapple, +1 Accuracy when attacking targets Grappled by it, and gains the ability to Boost and take reactions while grappling.

GRAVITY RIFLE.on_hit: Targets must pass a Hull save or be pulled in a straight line towards the Spacer, up to 10 spaces or until they hit an obstruction. If they collide with an obstruction, they are additionally knocked Prone.
GRAVITY RIFLE.name: GRAVITY RIFLE

HADES MISSILES.name: HADES MISSILES
HADES MISSILES.effect: All characters in a Cone 3 area starting within range 20 of the Rainmaker take {4/6/8} Energy damage and 2 heat, half if they pass an Agility save. This system doesn’t need line of sight, just a possible route to the target.

HAIL OF FIRE.name: HAIL OF FIRE
HAIL OF FIRE.effect: The Archer chooses an enemy character within Range 10: they become Immobilized and Impaired until the end of their next turn, until the Archer is Stunned or Jammed, or until the target allows the Archer to attack them with a single weapon as a reaction.

HARDENED TARGET.name: HARDENED TARGET
HARDENED TARGET.effect: The Exotic gains +1 Accuracy on Systems saves, and tech attacks against them receive +1 Difficulty.

HARDLIGHT COVER SYSTEM.name: HARDLIGHT COVER SYSTEM
HARDLIGHT COVER SYSTEM.effect: As a quick action, deploy a line3 hardlight wall. The wall is immune to damage and effects and grants hard cover. Characters that receive this cover gain Resistance to damage from Line, Blast, Burst, and Cone attacks.

HARPOON CANNON.name: HARPOON CANNON
HARPOON CANNON.on_hit: Targets of smaller or equal Size to the Berserker are pulled adjacent to them in a straight line, or as close as possible. If they’re larger, the Berserker is pulled adjacent to them instead. If the target ends their movement adjacent, the Berserker Grapples them.

HA BLACKWALL SYSTEM.name: HA BLACKWALL SYSTEM
HA BLACKWALL SYSTEM.effect: As a full action, the Aegis generates a pitch-black wall of blinkspace 5 spaces high covering a line10 area starting within range 5. All spaces must be free. The wall blocks line of sight, effects or attacks and provides hard cover. Characters that start their turn in the wall or who enter it on their turn roll 1d6. On a 4+ they are removed from play until the end of their next turn, when they reappear in a free space of their choice in Range 10 of the wall. If there are no free spaces, they return when a space becomes free. The wall lasts until the Aegis ends it as a quick action, or is destroyed. When it ends, characters remaining in blinkspace reappear.

HEADSHOT.name: HEADSHOT
HEADSHOT.effect: 1/round, on a critical hit, the Veteran’s target must pass a Hull save or only be able to draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the end of their next turn.

HIGH-IMPACT SHELLS.name: HIGH-IMPACT SHELLS
HIGH-IMPACT SHELLS.effect: On a hit, the Bombard Cannon knocks targets 3 spaces away from the Bombard.

HIGH IMPACT ROUNDS.name: HIGH IMPACT ROUNDS
HIGH IMPACT ROUNDS.effect: These high-caliber rounds can only be used with the Heavy Assault Rifle. When firing with these rounds, the Assault’s attacks become AP and deal +4 kinetic damage, but the Heavy Assault Rifle must be reloaded before it is used again (as though it was Loading).

HIVE.name: 蜂巢
HIVE.flavor: In theory, drones and drone swarms developed after the Deimos Event are not too different from their older cousins: they establish a local omninetwork; fabricate and deploy a century or half-century of drones; and then coordinate them to achieve their objectives. Still, the complex handler–trainer relationships that allow pilots to segue between direct control and autonomous operation cause psychological trauma after a month of continuous drone operation. It is recommended that they cycle their paired hive nexus every two weeks.
HIVE.tactics: Hives use Razor Swarm to control the battlefield, granting soft cover to their allies and denying areas to their enemies. Deploy swarms and use Drone Barrage to lock down enemies, or move them into the range of swarms and allies.

Homing Node.name: Homing Node
Homing Node.effect: Homing node (SIZE 1, HP 1, E-DEFENSE 10, EVASION 10, Tags: DEPLOYABLE) Once deployed, these count as Climate Nodes; however, they only provide Immunity to adjacent characters, rather than characters within Range 3

HOPPING MINES.name: HOPPING MINES
HOPPING MINES.effect: Mines deployed with Lay Mines also activate when hostile characters fly or move up to 10 spaces above them, jumping up to 10 spaces high to detonate next to the first character they run into.

HORNET.name: 马蜂
HORNET.flavor: SatriaBarong’s Espada range of half-frame mechs has long been a popular choice in the chassis racing circuit; notably, Espadas are the mechs of choice for the vaunted SatriaBarong–ShimanoLUX chassis racing team. Recently, SatriaBarong – with the blessing of SSC – has moved to create a mil-spec, de-licensed variant of the Espada without the ShimanoLUX branding, giving rise to the Hornet archetype, a platform open for other companies to adapt and improve. The most notable of these competitors is Chandrasekhar & Herschel, the primary sponsor of the new Blueshift Grand Prix racing circuit.
HORNET.tactics: Hornets are small, fast controllers that are extremely hard to hit and incredibly annoying. They deal limited damage, but their ability to inflict mobility-reducing conditions is great for locking down enemy strikers. Fortunately for their enemies, Hornets have a low E-Defense that makes them vulnerable to smart weaponry and tech attacks.

Horror.name: Horror
Horror.description: Artificial horrors beyond human comprehension. From biosynth-hybrid mechs and nanite-swarm gestalt-schools to phase-shifted tachyon phantoms. A horror may come in many forms, but those that are forced to face one in combat will always recognize it for what it is.

HOUND MISSILES.name: HOUND MISSILES
HOUND MISSILES.effect:
Hound Missile (Size 1/2, HP {10/15/20}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone).
The Rainmaker deploys the Hound Missile in an adjacent space and picks a target in range 20 and line of sight. At the start of the Rainmaker’s turns the missile flies 3 spaces towards its target, 6 if the target has Lock On. It moves directly, maneuvering round cover and terrain if needed. When it collides with a character or reaches its target, it creates a Burst 1 explosion. Characters in the affected area take {16/20/24} Energy damage, half if they pass an Agility save.

HUNGER/PURSUIT LIMPETS.effect: The Barricade rapidly prints and deploys a field of tiny, mobile mines in a free Size 4 area adjacent to them. The affected area becomes difficult terrain; additionally, hostile characters that enter the area for the first time in a round or start their turn there must succeed on a Systems save or be Slowed until the end of their next turn.
HUNGER/PURSUIT LIMPETS.name: HUNGER/PURSUIT LIMPETS

HUNKER DOWN.name: HUNKER DOWN
HUNKER DOWN.effect: Gain Resistance to all damage from the attack.
HUNKER DOWN.trigger: An attack hits the Assault, but damage hasn’t been rolled yet.

IMPALE.name: IMPALE
IMPALE.effect: The Cataphract moves up to 8 spaces in a straight line. Pick a character that the Cataphract passed through or ended adjacent to; they make a Hull save at +1 Difficulty. On a failure, they are grappled by the Cataphract and pulled with the Cataphract to the end of their movement.

IMPALE SYSTEMS.name: IMPALE SYSTEMS
IMPALE SYSTEMS.effect: The Hornet makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a hit, they take {3/4/5} Heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn.

IMPENDING THREAT.name: IMPENDING THREAT
IMPENDING THREAT.effect: The character must choose: lose the triggering action/movement, or continue but let the Archer immediately attack them with a single weapon.
IMPENDING THREAT.trigger: A hostile character in line of sight and Range 10 from the Archer moves or takes action.

IMPRISON.effect:
The Spite chooses a character within SENSORS and line of sight: they must pass a SYSTEMS save or take {4/5/6} Energy and become infected by a catalyzing virus. While affected by this virus they cannot clear any heat by any means (except for overheating). This effect lasts for the rest of the scene, until the Spite is destroyed, or until the affected character moves adjacent to the Spite. While at least one character is affected by the virus, the Spite is IMMOBILIZED.
Targets that already suffer from the virus take double damage if imprisoned again.
IMPRISON.name: IMPRISON

Industrial Clamps.name: Industrial Clamps
Industrial Clamps.effect: The Industrial gains +1 Accuracy to Grapple. This weapon automatically hits Grappled characters.

INVESTITURE.name: INVESTITURE
INVESTITURE.effect: The Priest links systems with an allied mech or vehicle within range 5. As long as they remain linked and within range 5, the target gets +{1/2/3} Accuracy on all attacks and can use the Priest’s Systems instead of their own. If either character becomes Jammed, Impaired, or Stunned, however, the other character also receives the condition for the same duration or until the link is disabled. The link is disabled if either character is destroyed or moves more than 5 spaces from the other. The Priest can only link with one character at a time.

JAMMING PYLON.name: JAMMING PYLON
JAMMING PYLON.effect:
JAMMING PYLON (SIZE 1, {5/6/8} HP, TAGS: DEPLOYABLE)
Once placed, this pylon creates a Burst 2 zone of static. Hostile characters within the affected area are JAMMED until they leave it. The pylon remains even if the Strider swaps kits.

JUDGEMENT SHOTGUN.on_hit: Target must pass an AGILITY save or be knocked PRONE.
JUDGEMENT SHOTGUN.name: JUDGEMENT SHOTGUN
JUDGEMENT SHOTGUN.effect: This weapon automatically reloads whenever an allied non-Grunt, non-Drone character within Range 3 is destroyed.

JUGGERNAUT.name: JUGGERNAUT
JUGGERNAUT.effect: At the start of the Ultra’s turn, they clear one condition. At the end of their turn, they repair one destroyed weapon or system.

KINETIC COMPENSATION.effect: Each time the Demolisher misses with the Demolition Hammer, they gain +1 Accuracy on all subsequent attacks until their next hit. This Accuracy can be gained multiple times, and stacks.
KINETIC COMPENSATION.name: KINETIC COMPENSATION

LANCE SHOT.name: LANCE SHOT
LANCE SHOT.effect: The Cataphract fires an electrified lance in a line5 path. All characters within the affected area must succeed on an Engineering save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn.

LAST WORD.name: LAST WORD
LAST WORD.effect: Characters in Burst 1 must pass an Agility save or take 2 kinetic damage and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. The Mercenary then moves spaces equal to Speed in any direction. This movement ignores engagement and doesn’t provoke reactions.
LAST WORD.trigger: The Mercenary is reduced to less than half their total HP.

LATCH DRONE.effect:
Latch Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/10/15}, Evasion 10, E-Defense 10, Tags: Drone)
This self-deploying drone clamps onto a character within Range 3, occupying the same space and moving with them. While the drone is attached, the target regains {5/8/10} HP at the start of each of their turns and gains +1 Accuracy on all checks, saves, and attacks. Enemies can target the drone with attacks.
LATCH DRONE.name: LATCH DRONE

LAY MINES.name: LAY MINES
LAY MINES.effect:
The Seeder deploys one of the mines below in a free space within range 3. Once deployed, the Seeder’s mines detonate when a hostile character moves over them, creating a Blast 1 explosion that affects both allied and hostile characters.
  • Stun Mine: Characters in the area that fail an Engineering save become Stunned until the end of their next turn.
  • Explosive Mine: Characters in the area take {8/12/16} Explosive damage, or half if they pass an Agility save.
  • Sealant Mine: Characters in the area that fail a Hull save become Immobilized until the end of their next turn, then Slowed until the end of their subsequent turn.
  • Shock Mine: Characters in the area that fail a Systems save become Jammed until the end of their next turn, then Impaired until the end of their subsequent turn.

The Seeder’s mines are Invisible and cannot be targeted, but hostile characters within Sensors can reveal them by succeeding on a Systems check. Characters can disarm them by succeeding on a Systems check as a quick action while in the same space; however, on a failure, the mine detonates.

LEAD THE CHARGE.name: LEAD THE CHARGE
LEAD THE CHARGE.effect: The Ultra can Boost. This reaction can be used any number of times a round.
LEAD THE CHARGE.trigger: A hostile character in line of sight moves.

LEAP.name: LEAP
LEAP.effect: The Assassin flies 6 spaces in any direction but must land on a surface. When they land, characters adjacent to the Assassin must succeed on an Agility save or be knocked Prone.

Leech.name: Leech
Leech.flavor: Sleek, strong, and fast, the Leech (or Asanbosam, as it is often referred to), was first employed by the Foreign Bodies Division in the Farm. Its niche is in supporting special operations where the preservation or elimination of a single combatant can ensure success or failure. Serving as the FBD’s most combat-flexible support platform, the Asanbosam is often deployed to accompany asset recovery missions in the Farm. Its unique design allows it to mold its chassis to that of allied or hostile forces, effectively leeching on to them, where it is then at its most potent
Leech.tactics: The Leech serves both controller and support roles on the battlefield. It is best used when accompanying fast and deadly chassis on a diverse range of target-elimination operations. Use it to bolster NPCs who need extra defenses or to target single PCs and disrupt their plans.

LIGHTNING REFLEXES.effect: Whenever the Veteran is attacked using any Heavy or Superheavy weapon, first roll 1d6. On 5+, the attack automatically misses.
LIGHTNING REFLEXES.name: LIGHTNING REFLEXES

LIMITED HANDLING.effect: The Vehicle must always move in a straight line, although it can move and Boost in separate directions. Additionally, the Vehicle can’t climb or swim, and can only clear Prone when adjacent to an allied character.
LIMITED HANDLING.name: LIMITED HANDLING

LIMITED MELEE ATTACKS.name: LIMITED MELEE ATTACKS
LIMITED MELEE ATTACKS.effect: The Ship can’t make melee attacks other than Ram.

LIMITLESS.effect: The Ultra can Overcharge. Instead of the standard cost, they always gain 1d6 heat.
LIMITLESS.name: LIMITLESS

LIVING CHASSIS.name: LIVING CHASSIS
LIVING CHASSIS.effect: This trait can only be chosen if the Exotic is a Mech. The Exotic becomes Biological.

LIVING WEAPONRY.name: LIVING WEAPONRY
LIVING WEAPONRY.effect: The Exotic gains Immunity to Jammed. Additionally, their weapons have biotechnical and semi-organic components that spontaneously generate ammunition. When the Exotic reloads Loading weapons, they also regain 1d6 HP.

LOCK/HOLD JAVELINS.name: LOCK/HOLD JAVELINS
LOCK/HOLD JAVELINS.effect: The Hornet fires a javelin at a character within range 5 and line of sight. The target must succeed on a Hull save or be impaled, at which point the javelin tethers itself and its victim to the ground (or another surface), rendering them Immobilized and Shredded. They, or any adjacent character, can attempt to remove the javelin with a successful Hull save as a full action; otherwise, this effect lasts for the rest of the scene or until the Hornet takes this action again.

Lonely Chassis.name: Lonely Chassis
Lonely Chassis.effect: While not Grappling, the Leech may move with adjacent allied characters when they move or boost on their turn as long as the movement started with the Leech in adjacency.

LURKER.name: 潜伏者
LURKER.tactics: Lurkers are slow but powerful enemies that are very scary inside of their SHROUD ZONES. Canny players will use hacking or smart weapons to disperse these zones and make Lurkers more vulnerable. Lurkers can use each other’s zones, so having multiple Lurkers on a battlefield can greatly multiply their power.
LURKER.flavor: Lurker-class foes are rare but terrifying sights on the battlefield. Usually utilizing greywash-analog nanite clouds and matter compressors, they move from swarm to swarm, lashing out with nanite whips and using their swarms to deflect blows as easily as water.

MANEUVERABLE.name: MANEUVERABLE
MANEUVERABLE.effect: The Spacer moves normally in zero-g environments.

MANIFEST FALSE IDOLS.name: MANIFEST FALSE IDOLS
MANIFEST FALSE IDOLS.effect: The Mirage creates three Size 1 data constructs in free spaces within line of sight and range 5. These constructs provide soft cover but can be passed through. When hostile characters pass through a construct, the construct disappears and they must succeed on a Systems save or take 2 heat and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. At any point during the Mirage’s turn, they can teleport an allied character within line of sight to the location of a data construct as a quick action, causing the construct to disappear, as long as there is space to do so.

MBT.name: 主战坦克
MBT.flavor: The tank remains a core component of modern military doctrine even in the era of combat chassis, with a history stretching back to the earliest days of pre-Fall armored warfare. Despite the many technological advances since then, the overall design of modern main battle tanks remains immediately recognizable; an armored vehicle housing a large, turreted primary weapon supplemented by secondary armaments, blending firepower, protective countermeasures, and mobility into a multipurpose unit capable of offensive or defensive maneuvers as necessary. While chassis tend to be much more flexible and configurable strike platforms, tanks make up for this with the ability to more easily mount heavier armor without compromising their ability to employ large- caliber weaponry while on the move. The sheer variety of tank configurations which can be found throughout the galaxy is perhaps more numerous than even chassis variants, with different nations, militaries, and even private companies all favoring designs that best suit their preferred combat doctrines.
MBT.tactics: The MBT is a heavily armored and heavily armed "setpiece" unit that can quickly overwhelm enemies with both their speed and firepower. Barraging with both its main gun and secondary weapon along with the option of using Tank Shock to run other characters over allows it to quickly deal a tremendous amount of damage, and Composite Armor makes it incredibly resilient, but it has to balance this with both the restrictions to its movement and its visible armored facing which makes it vulnerable to being flanked. Choosing when to fire from range and when to press the attack are key to getting the most out of this unit.

MERCENARY.description: Mercenaries offer their services to the highest bidder. They may have an attachment to a faith or flag, but when it comes to doing business, they’re loyal only to the highest bidder.
MERCENARY.name: 雇佣兵

MERCENARY SYSTEMS AND TRAITS.name: MERCENARY SYSTEMS AND TRAITS
MERCENARY SYSTEMS AND TRAITS.effect: When choosing optional systems, the Mercenary can also choose from the Mercenary Systems and Traits list.

METAFOLD SHOVE.name: METAFOLD SHOVE
METAFOLD SHOVE.effect: The Mirage makes a tech attack against a hostile character within range 5. On a success, the target swaps position with an allied character within the Mirage’s line of sight and chosen by the Mirage, both teleporting. Flying characters can’t be swapped with characters that aren’t flying, and vice versa.

Meteorological Graywash.name: Meteorological Graywash
Meteorological Graywash.effect:
At the start of combat the Tempest may select one graywash effect from each of the below categories to have readied for the duration of combat

At the Start of the Tempest's turn it may activate one of its three readied graywash effects, starting at Category I, then Category II, then Category III, and then beginning again at Category I. Multiple instances of the same graywash effect cannot be active at any one time.

At the end of each of its turns, the Tempest takes 2 Heat per effect active. It can end an effect as a free action at the end of its turn. The Tempest may not take Heat from this system if doing so would exceed its Heat Cap

Characters are only affected by graywash effects while they are within the Tempest's Sensors

GRAYWASH EFFECTS

Category I:

SUBZERO WASH: Any characters that do not move or Boost on their turn become Immobilized at the end of their turn and remain Immobilized until they take a quick action to automatically clear the condition.

SOLAR WASH: All characters take +1 heat from all self-inflicted heat, OVERCHARGE, OVERKILL, and heat from external sources

MAELSTROM WASH: All flying characters move as if they are in difficult terrain and characters on the ground are automatically Slowed.

GALE-FORCE WASH: At the end of each character’s turn they are pushed 2/3/4 spaces in any direction of the Tempest’s choice

Category II:

INTERCEPTOR WASH: Upon activation, a character chosen by the Tempest gains RESISTANCE to one of the following damage types: explosive, kinetic, or energy damage, from ranged and melee attacks for the duration of this effect.

ILLUSORY WASH: Upon activation, all allied characters adjacent to the Tempest and one other allied character chosen by the Tempest and become INVISIBLE.

STATIC WASH: Upon activation, a character chosen by the Tempest automatically deals 2 heat to characters it becomes adjacent to for the first time in a round

DISRUPTER WASH: Hostile tech attacks against an allied character chosen by the Tempest upon activation receive +2 DIFFICULTY.

Category III

CORROSIVE WASH: The Tempest chooses a character: the target must pass a Hull save or take +3/4/5 AP on the next ranged or melee attack against them, hit or miss. This effects lasts until the Tempest halts this effect or a Climate Node is destroyed.

DERECHO WASH: The Tempest chooses a character: the target must succeed on an Agility save or become Shredded until the Tempest halts this effect or a Climate Node is destroyed.

SANDSTORM WASH: The Tempest chooses a character: the target must succeed on a Systems save or only be able to draw line of sight to adjacent spaces until the Tempest halts this effect or a Climate Node is destroyed.

SKYFIRE WASH: The Tempest chooses a character: they must pass an Engineering save or be struck by lighting and take 1/2/3 Heat and 1/2/3 Burn until the Tempest halts this effect or a Climate Node is destroyed.

MICRO-MISSILE BARRAGE.name: MICRO-MISSILE BARRAGE
MICRO-MISSILE BARRAGE.effect: The Assault launches a Line 8 volley of micro-missiles. All characters within the affected area must succeed on a Hull save or take {6/8/10} kinetic damage. On a successful save, they take half damage.

MILITARY DISCIPLINE.name: MILITARY DISCIPLINE
MILITARY DISCIPLINE.effect: Allied characters adjacent to the Commander gain +1 Accuracy on all attacks, saves and checks.

MIRAGE.flavor: Mirage-class mechs are often found in the employ of HORIZON-aligned militant groups. With no originating manufacturer, they are one of the few open-source non-HORUS pattern groups available to cells that know where to look. Mirages deploy advanced liturgicode to wrap themselves and their allies in veils of illusion and misdirection. While it’s clear that the warping effects that surround these mechs are caused by sensor distortion, they are powerful enough to affect even organic systems – exercise caution when engaging.
MIRAGE.name: 蜃楼
MIRAGE.tactics: Mirages are potent support mechs, able to teleport their allies around at will and shut down ranged attackers with Warp Sensors. They can make allied characters Invisible, but become vulnerable while doing so. These strengths come at a price: weapons and systems that ignore cover – such as Seeking weapons – can get around Warp Sensors, and Mirages don’t deal any damage on their own.

MISSILE PODS.name: MISSILE PODS
MISSILE PODS.effect: This weapon can attack 1-3 characters at a time.

MISSILE SWARM.name: MISSILE SWARM
MISSILE SWARM.effect: This weapon deals double damage to characters with Lock On and doesn’t affect allied characters.

Mobile Bunker.name: Mobile Bunker
Mobile Bunker.effect: Adjacent allied characters can use the MBT for hard cover. Characters gain resistance to damage from Blast, Burst, Line, and Cone attacks while benefiting from this cover.

MOBILE PRINTER.name: MOBILE PRINTER
MOBILE PRINTER.effect: The Barricade prints a Size 2 cube in a free and adjacent area. The cube provides hard cover and is a single object with 20 HP and Evasion 5.

MOBILE TURRETS.name: MOBILE TURRETS
MOBILE TURRETS.effect: At the start of the Engineer’s turn, they can move all deployable turrets up to 3 spaces in any direction.

MONOWIRE SWORD.name: MONOWIRE SWORD
MONOWIRE SWORD.effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

Monsoon Nanite Dispensers.name: Monsoon Nanite Dispensers
Monsoon Nanite Dispensers.on_hit: On hit, targets become Impaired and Slowed until the end of their next turn.

MOVING TARGET.trigger: A character in line of sight and range 20 moves.
MOVING TARGET.name: MOVING TARGET
MOVING TARGET.effect: The Sniper interrupts the movement. The character must either give up the triggering action/ movement, or be immediately attacked by the Sniper using the Anti-materiel Rifle. If the rifle isn’t loaded, the Sniper instead reloads it.

Multi-Directional Charges.name: Multi-Directional Charges
Multi-Directional Charges.effect: This weapon ignores ranged penalties from Engaged.

MULTIPLICITY.name: MULTIPLICITY
MULTIPLICITY.trigger: A allied character in line of sight is hit.
MULTIPLICITY.effect: The attacker must make a Systems save. On a failure, the Mirage’s ally gains Immunity to the attack’s damage and effects and may teleport up to 5 spaces in the direction of their choice.

Mutations.effect: The Horror may choose 1 option from the Horror Mutations list plus an additional option per tier.
Mutations.name: Mutations

NAIL GUN.name: NAIL GUN
NAIL GUN.on_hit: Target rolls an Agility save. On a failure, they are Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

Nanite Typhoon Cannon.on_hit: On hit, if this weapon’s KNOCKBACK would cause the target to collide with an obstruction large enough to stop their movement, they must succeed on a HULL save or take 4 kinetic damage
Nanite Typhoon Cannon.name: Nanite Typhoon Cannon

NANO-REPAIR CLOUD.name: NANO-REPAIR CLOUD
NANO-REPAIR CLOUD.effect: While they are adjacent to the Support, allied characters roll twice on all saves and mech skill checks and choose the higher result.

NATURAL CAMOUFLAGE.name: NATURAL CAMOUFLAGE
NATURAL CAMOUFLAGE.effect: The Monstrosity is Invisible while adjacent to any terrain or cover, and treats soft cover as hard cover.

NEAR-THREAT DENIAL SYSTEM.name: NEAR-THREAT DENIAL SYSTEM
NEAR-THREAT DENIAL SYSTEM.effect: When characters within range 3 attack the Bastion, they take {2/3/4} AP Explosive damage before rolling.

NHP CO-PILOT.name: NHP CO-PILOT
NHP CO-PILOT.effect: The Veteran gains the AI tag. Their mech or vehicle is autonomous and can even function without a pilot. The NHP can enter cascade, using the same rules as PC AIs.

OPPORTUNIST.name: OPPORTUNIST
OPPORTUNIST.effect: The Mercenary gains +1 Accuracy on attacks when their target is Engaged by an allied character.

ORBITAL STRIKE.name: ORBITAL STRIKE
ORBITAL STRIKE.effect: The Scout chooses a space on the ground, within line of sight and range 20; all characters know that it has been chosen. The Scout calls in an orbital bombardment that hits at the end of the next round, creating a Burst 2 explosion. Characters in the affected area must make Agility saves. On a fail, they take {12/16/20} Energy damage and are knocked Prone. On a pass, they take half damage and remain standing.

PAINMAKER.name: PAINMAKER
PAINMAKER.effect: The Breacher chooses a character within range 3. Their next turn is delayed until after their target’s. At the start of the Breacher’s turn, if the target is still within range 3, the Breacher may attack them four times with Dual Shotguns – instead of twice – as a free action.

Paired Talons MK II.name: Paired Talons MK II
Paired Talons MK II.effect:
This weapon gains +1 Accuracy when attacking a character Grappled by the Leech.

On hit, as a free action, the Leech my take 2 heat to make an additional attack, and it may continue to make additional attacks on hits unless the Heat it takes would cause it to exceed its Heat Cap.

Pintle-Mounted Machine Gun.name: Pintle-Mounted Machine Gun
Pintle-Mounted Machine Gun.effect: This weapon can attack two targets at a time.

PIN.name: PIN
PIN.effect: A character within range 2 becomes Immobilized and Impaired until they either damage the Goliath, the Goliath is Stunned or destroyed, or the Goliath targets another character with this effect. The Goliath is Immobilized for the duration of this effect.

PIRATE.name: 海盗
PIRATE.description: Pirates live on the boundaries—the forgotten bolt-holes of occupied space. They range far, operating around blink gates, interstellar shipping lanes, and worlds that are yet to be settled. They can be found wherever resources are kept or moved, people are desperate, and the law is stretched thin.

PIRATE SYSTEMS AND TRAITS.name: PIRATE SYSTEMS AND TRAITS
PIRATE SYSTEMS AND TRAITS.effect: When choosing optional systems, the Pirate can also choose from the Pirate Systems and Traits list.

POINT-DEFENSE SHIELD.name: POINT-DEFENSE SHIELD
POINT-DEFENSE SHIELD.effect: The Cataphract has Resistance to all damage from the closest hostile character. If multiple characters are equally close, this effect does not apply.

Portable Barricade.name: Portable Barricade
Portable Barricade.effect: The Marine can deploy a Size 1 barrier in a free adjacent area for each Limited charge expended when they activate this system. These barriers have 10 HP each, Evasion 5, and a Burst 1 area around each barrier counts as difficult terrain for hostile characters only.

POWER DEPLOYER.name: POWER DEPLOYER
POWER DEPLOYER.effect: The Engineer can deploy two turrets at a time with Deployable Turrets. If they do so, the system counts as Recharge 4+ until it next recharges.

POWER KNUCKLE.name: POWER KNUCKLE
POWER KNUCKLE.effect: A character within range 2 must pass a Hull save or take {4/5/6} Kinetic damage, be pushed 5 spaces directly away from the Goliath, and knocked Prone.

PREDATORY LOGIC.name: PREDATORY LOGIC
PREDATORY LOGIC.effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target immediately and as a reaction uses a weapon chosen by the Witch to attack a character within Range chosen by the Witch.

PULSE LASER.name: PULSE LASER
PULSE LASER.effect: At T2–3 this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting the same character or two different ones.

PUNISHER AMMUNITION.name: PUNISHER AMMUNITION
PUNISHER AMMUNITION.effect: Characters damaged by the Sentinel’s Overwatch attacks also become Slowed until the end of their next turn.

Quadruped.name: Quadruped
Quadruped.effect: The Horror gains Immunity to Prone and may move up to 4 spaces as a protocol.

QUICK MARCH.name: QUICK MARCH
QUICK MARCH.effect: One allied character within line of sight of the Commander may Boost.

RAINMAKER.name: 祈雨师
RAINMAKER.flavor: The tongue-in-cheek “Rainmaker” nickname describes mechs and pilots that specialize in the use of rockets and missiles. Favored by flexible combat units, Rainmakers are mobile platforms loaded with ordnance and capable of handling engagements at any range, against any target.
RAINMAKER.tactics: Rainmakers are one part artillery and one part controller. Their Javelin Rockets force characters to avoid certain areas or take guaranteed damage. They can also dish out delayed damage through optional systems like Hound Missiles and Atlas Missiles. Like other artillery mechs, Rainmakers are relatively vulnerable on their own.

RAMPAGE.name: RAMPAGE
RAMPAGE.effect: The Monstrosity moves spaces equal to Speed in a straight line, ignoring reactions and engagement and moving freely through spaces occupied by other characters. Characters it passes through or adjacent to must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/6/8} kinetic damage.

RAPTOR PLASMA RIFLE.name: RAPTOR PLASMA RIFLE
RAPTOR PLASMA RIFLE.effect: At T2, this weapon can make two attacks at a time, targeting either the same character or two different ones. At T3, it can make three attacks at a time.

RAVAGER TURRET.name: RAVAGER TURRET
RAVAGER TURRET.effect: This weapon simultaneously attacks every hostile character within line of sight and Range.

RAZOR SWARMS.name: RAZOR SWARMS
RAZOR SWARMS.effect: The Hive deploys a Blast 1 razor swarm in a free area within Sensors. Allied characters gain soft cover as long as they are at least partially within the affected area. Hostile characters start their turn at least partially within the area or move into it for the first time in a round take {2/4/6} Burn. The Hive can deploy any number of razor swarms, each of which persists for the rest of the scene or until the Hive is destroyed.

READY AND WAITING.name: READY AND WAITING
READY AND WAITING.effect: The Elite takes two separate turns each round.

REALSPACE EXTRUSION.name: REALSPACE EXTRUSION
REALSPACE EXTRUSION.effect: This Exotic is actually an extrusion of a higher-concept entity from non-physical space, and only partially corporeal. The Exotic gains Resistance to all damage; however, they only deal half damage and other characters can freely pass through and end turns in spaces they occupy as though they aren’t there.

Reflexive Graywash Blackwall.effect:
Trigger: A Climate Node within SENSORS and line of sight is hit by an attack.

Effect: After damage is rolled, the Tempest may reduce the damage to 0.
Reflexive Graywash Blackwall.name: Reflexive Graywash Blackwall

REFLEX.name: REFLEX
REFLEX.effect: The Ultra can Overwatch unlimited times per round.

REGENERATIVE SHIELDING.name: REGENERATIVE SHIELDING
REGENERATIVE SHIELDING.effect: The Aegis has Immunity to Impaired and Slowed and can’t be critically hit.

REGENERATOR.name: REGENERATOR
REGENERATOR.effect: At the end of its turn, the Monstrosity regains 1/4 of its total HP. It doesn’t regain any HP if it has taken Energy damage during the same round.

REINFORCED.name: REINFORCED
REINFORCED.effect: The Commander gains +1 Structure and +1 Stress.

RELOCATION.name: RELOCATION
RELOCATION.trigger: An enemy character in line of sight moves.

REMOTE CLOUD.name: REMOTE CLOUD
REMOTE CLOUD.effect: The Support releases a Blast 2 nanite cloud within range 5. Allied characters that start their turn in the area or move into it for the first time on their turn regain {2/4/6} HP. The cloud disperses at the start of the Support’s next turn.

REMOTE REBOOT.name: REMOTE REBOOT
REMOTE REBOOT.effect: The Support clears any two of the following conditions currently affecting an allied character in range 5: Impaired, Jammed, Stunned, and Slowed.

REPOSITION.name: REPOSITION
REPOSITION.effect: The Strider may move its SPEED in spaces.

REPULSION FIELD.name: REPULSION FIELD
REPULSION FIELD.effect: When hostile characters start their turn adjacent to the Ultra or become adjacent to the Ultra for the first time on their turn, they take {2/4/6} Energy damage + 2 heat and must succeed on a Systems save or become Impaired until the end of their next turn.

RIPPER CLAWS.name: RIPPER CLAWS
RIPPER CLAWS.effect: This weapon deals double damage when used within a SHROUD ZONE

Rivet Cannon.name: Rivet Cannon
Rivet Cannon.effect: This Attack can make {1/2/3} attacks. If one of these attacks knocks a character back into a piece of terrain that stops their movement, they become Immobilized until the end of their next turn.

Rock Drill.name: Rock Drill
Rock Drill.effect: Additionally, the Industrial may automatically deal 50 AP kinetic damage to an adjacent piece of terrain as a quick action.

RODEO MASTER.name: RODEO MASTER
RODEO MASTER.effect: The Veteran can Dismount. While on foot, the Veteran uses the Human class and can take all actions available to PC pilots, including Jockey.

Rolling Thunder.name: Rolling Thunder
Rolling Thunder.effect: The MBT can't take the Grunt template, and only a single MBT may be present in any scene.

RONIN.name: 浪人
RONIN.tactics: Ronins are no-nonsense, high-damage melee strikers. Rebound makes it dangerous for enemies to attack Ronins with ranged weapons, but they tend to suffer against armored enemies and are heavily reliant on Accuracy.
RONIN.flavor:
Ronin frames differ from those favored by Berserkers and Demolishers in that they aren’t retrofitted or improvised for creative tactical applications – they are purpose-built to excel in melee combat by boutique fabricators. Although they are seen as somewhat antique by many commentators, the rise of stasis- and mag-based defensive technologies has made Ronins more viable in modern combat.
Ronin are common among both martial cultures and performance-combat firms, where their superb melee abilities elevate them above the competition. They see less use in cultures that have a preference for ranged combat, but there is a certain prestige accorded to pilots who adopt ancient weapons and survive to do it again. The mythic lancer Susanoo elevated this archetype to legendary status when she endorsed the GRAMtech Strike-1 chassis, which she piloted alongside numerous Albatross wings during the Neo-Celestine Disappointment.

RPV.name: RPV
RPV.description: Remote-pilot vehicles – RPVs – are any mechs piloted by NHPs, offsite pilots, or comp/con units. They trade e-war vulnerability for individual unit strength, and can operate outside the restrictions imposed on systems piloted by organic, in-vehicle units.

SANCTUARY.name: SANCTUARY
SANCTUARY.effect: The Priest chooses an allied character within Sensors. Before attacking the target, characters must first pass a Systems save. On a failure, the target cannot be targeted again by the attacker until the start of that character’s next turn.

SCOURING WHIP.name: SCOURING WHIP
SCOURING WHIP.effect:
This weapon gains Threat 3 and +1 Accuracy when used within a SHROUD ZONE.
  • On hit: The target is pulled adjacent to the Lurker, or as close as possible.
  • On critical hit: As above, and the target is immediately GRAPPLED.
SCOURING WHIP.on_hit: The target is pulled adjacent to the Lurker, or as close as possible.

SEALANT GUN.name: SEALANT GUN
SEALANT GUN.effect:
The Support chooses a character within line of sight and Range 5, allied or hostile:
  • Allied: The target clears all Burn, but becomes Slowed until the end of their next turn.
  • Hostile: The target must succeed on an Agility save or become Slowed until the end of their next turn. Succeed or fail, a Burst 1 area around them becomes difficult terrain for the rest of the scene.

SEALANT TRAP.name: SEALANT TRAP
SEALANT TRAP.effect: When a hostile character moves adjacent to the mine, characters within a Burst 1 area are covered with a spray of thick, fast-drying sealant and become Immobilized. They remain stuck until the sealant takes sufficient damage to break; it counts as having {5/10/15} HP and Evasion 5.

SEISMIC REPULSOR.effect: All non-flying characters within a Burst 3 area must pass a Hull save or be knocked 3 spaces back from the Barricade and knocked Prone. The affected area becomes difficult terrain for the rest of the scene.
SEISMIC REPULSOR.name: SEISMIC REPULSOR

SEIZE.name: SEIZE
SEIZE.effect: A hostile character within SENSORS and line of sight must pass a SYSTEMS save or take 2/3/4 Heat and become IMMOBILIZED until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take no heat and are instead SLOWED until the end of their next turn.

SELECTIVE LOADER.name: SELECTIVE LOADER
SELECTIVE LOADER.effect:
The Sniper can choose a special ammunition type before attacking with the Anti-Materiel Rifle. Attacks made with this ammunition function as usual, with an additional effect on a successful attack.
The Sniper may choose from the following:
  • Electromagnetic: Targets must must pass an Systems save or become Jammed until the end of their next turn.
  • Flare: Targets lose Hide or Invisible and cannot gain those statuses until the end of their next turn.
  • Impact: Targets must pass an Hull save or be knocked Prone.
  • Molten: Targets must pass an Engineering save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

SHEPHERD FIELD.name: SHEPHERD FIELD
SHEPHERD FIELD.effect: Drones, objects, and pieces of cover gain Resistance to all damage while next to the Engineer.

SHIP.name: 飞船
SHIP.description:
Whether civilian or military, Ships are defined by their flight capability and designed for space travel. Although they are mostly used outside the bounds of an atmosphere, most can operate closer to the ground when needed.
This template can be applied to any Mech NPC. They lose the Mech tag and become a Ship instead.

SHOCK AND AWE.name: SHOCK AND AWE
SHOCK AND AWE.effect:
The Ultra takes two separate turns each round. They regain spent reactions each time they take a turn.
If the Ultra is facing five or more hostile characters when combat begins, the Ultra takes a third turn each round.

SHOCK ARMOR.effect: The Veteran gains Resistance to damage from Main weapons.
SHOCK ARMOR.name: SHOCK ARMOR

SHOCK PLATING.name: SHOCK PLATING
SHOCK PLATING.effect: The Barricade has Resistance to kinetic damage.

SHORT-CYCLE LANCE.name: SHORT-CYCLE LANCE
SHORT-CYCLE LANCE.effect: Draw a line 30 path: characters within the affected area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1 structure damage. On a success, they are reduced to 1 HP. Objects smaller than Size 5 are completely annihilated.

SIEGE KIT SWAP BONUS.trigger: The Strider swaps to the SIEGE KIT.
SIEGE KIT SWAP BONUS.name: SIEGE KIT SWAP BONUS
SIEGE KIT SWAP BONUS.effect: Swap bonus: The Strider scatters caltrops in a Blast 1 zone within Range 5, turning it into difficult terrain for the rest of the scene. They then deploy a SIZE 1 piece of hard cover in any free adjacent space, which also remains for the rest of the scene.

Siege Mode.name: Siege Mode
Siege Mode.effect: The MBT extends (or retracts) stabilizers that cause it to become Immobilized as long as this system is active. While extended, the MBT's Main Gun gains Arcing and +5 Range (or adds +5 to the length of any Lines), but the MBT cannot make ranged attacks against or centered on characters, objects, or spaces within Range 3 using its Main Gun.

SIEGE SHIELD.name: SIEGE SHIELD
SIEGE SHIELD.effect: The Ultra gains Resistance to all damage from attacks that originate beyond range 3.

SIGHT.name: SIGHT
SIGHT.effect: The Scout ignores Hidden and Invisible – they know the precise location of all characters within Sensors.

SKYLIGHT Anti-Air Laser.name: SKYLIGHT Anti-Air Laser
SKYLIGHT Anti-Air Laser.on_hit: If the target is flying, they must pass an Agility save or choose one: either take +1d6 bonus damage, or immediately land (this counts as falling without any damage) and become unable to fly until the end of their next turn.

SKYSHIELD PROTOCOL.name: SKYSHIELD PROTOCOL
SKYSHIELD PROTOCOL.effect: Deployable Turrets gain +2 Accuracy against flying targets.

SLAVER SIGNAL.name: SLAVER SIGNAL
SLAVER SIGNAL.effect: A piloted mech or vehicle within Range 10 must make a Systems save. On a failure, all pilots and other Biological characters inside the target are overcome by the signal, becoming Stunned. Unless their mech or vehicle has an AI, it also becomes Stunned. If any affected characters (or their mech or vehicle) take damage, they are jolted awake – ending the effect. Characters adjacent to the target can also end the effect by blotting out the signal with a successful Systems check as a full action. Otherwise, the effect lasts until the Pirate is destroyed.

SLIPPERY.name: SLIPPERY
SLIPPERY.effect: The Veteran’s standard moves ignore engagement and don’t provoke reactions.

Smokescreen.name: Smokescreen
Smokescreen.effect: The MBT creates a Blast 2 area of dense, sensor-jamming smoke within Range 5, and may immediately Boost into it as a free action. This area lasts until the end of the MBT's next turn, and all characters and objects within it gain soft cover. The first time the MBT and any allied characters enter this area, they clear Lock On.

SMOKE GRENADE.effect: The Strider launches a smoke grenade at a space within line of sight and Range 5, creating a Blast 1 patch of smoke. The area provides soft cover until the end of the scene.
SMOKE GRENADE.name: SMOKE GRENADE

Smoothbore Cannon.name: Smoothbore Cannon
Smoothbore Cannon.effect:
On Miss: A Size 1 section of any object adjacent to the target (e.g., cover, deployable equipment, buildings, or terrain), takes {10/20/30} AP explosive damage.
This weapon deals {10/20/30} AP explosive damage to objects, cover, and terrain.

SNIPER.name: 狙击手
SNIPER.flavor: The reason some pilots haven’t seen a Sniper on the battlefield is that those pilots are dead. These mechs are built for stability, targeting, and extremely long-range  kinetic damage weapons at the cost of mobility, and they tend to operate in small, self-sufficient teams far removed from direct combat. Sniper pilots are a proud breed, emphasizing economy and elegance over destructive power.
SNIPER.tactics: Rightly feared, Snipers are devastating when it comes to dealing focused damage. Using Sniper’s Mark, they can deal direct structure damage, making short work of almost any character. Opponents can avoid this with clever use of cover, or by dropping Prone. Snipers’ main downside is that they need to be fairly stationary to do their best work, as their rifle requires a full action to fire.

SNIPER’S MARK.name: SNIPER’S MARK
SNIPER’S MARK.effect:
A character within line of sight and range 25 gains the Sniper’s Mark. Against targets with the Sniper’s Mark, the Anti-Materiel Rifle deals 1 structure damage instead of its usual damage.
Characters know when they have the Sniper’s Mark. They ignore it and take damage normally if they are in cover or Prone. On their turn, characters with the Sniper’s Mark may drop Prone as a free action.
The Sniper can only mark one character at a time but can transfer the Sniper’s Mark to another character as a full action.

SPACER.name: 太空民
SPACER.description: Spacers are those born and bred in the hard vacuum of the endless void. They are adept at maneuvering in and around the difficult, low-g environments found only in space and low orbit – blink and space stations, asteroid fields, and the emptiness between ships in military and commercial fleets.

SPACER SYSTEMS.name: SPACER SYSTEMS
SPACER SYSTEMS.effect: When choosing optional systems, the Spacer can also choose from the Spacer Systems list.

Special Munitions.effect:
This character’s Ranged Attacks gain “On critical hit: The target is knocked Prone.”
Additionally, before making a Ranged Attack that deals Kinetic, Energy, or Explosive Damage, the Spec Ops may swap that damage type for one of the other two.
Special Munitions.name: Special Munitions

SPECTER.name: 幽鬼
SPECTER.tactics: Specters are mobile strikers that shine against foes that make the mistake of being caught alone. Use Prowl along with their high Threat and Speed to get them across the front lines so they can find vulnerable solo targets, like snipers and artillery. Specters are permanently Invisible, which is key to their survivability; they aren’t very resilient, but they can Hide any time.
SPECTER.flavor: The principle behind the development of Specter-archetype mechs is a simple one: not being hit is better than the strongest armor. Specters employ cutting-edge optical-electronic camouflage to vanish from the battlefield and enemy scans. They flicker in and out of vision, confusing the eye and the radar. That’s what makes them so deadly, though their weapons certainly help.

Spec Op.name: Spec Op
Spec Op.description: Expertly trained and equipped individuals that often deploy in teams to increase their deadly potential even further. Those that end up on the wrong side of such a strike team should exercise extreme caution.

SPINNING KICK.effect: The Assassin chooses a character next to them: they must pass a Hull save or be pushed 4 spaces away from the Assassin and knocked Prone.
SPINNING KICK.name: SPINNING KICK

SPOTTER.name: SPOTTER
SPOTTER.effect: While adjacent to the Scout, allied characters gain +1 Accuracy on all attack rolls.

SPREAD OUT.name: SPREAD OUT
SPREAD OUT.effect: Instead of tracking the position of individual soldiers, the Squad’s members are assumed to move freely within the space it occupies. Other characters can freely move through and end their turn in spaces occupied by the Squad, and as long as the Squad occupies at least 2 free spaces it can end its turn overlapping obstructions, cover, or other characters. As its size doesn’t reflect its mass, the Squad cannot Grapple or Ram.

SPREAD SUFFERING.name: SPREAD SUFFERING
SPREAD SUFFERING.effect: 1/round, when the Witch uses Quick Tech or Full Tech, they can repeat the option they chose as a free action targeting any character adjacent to the primary target.

SQUAD.name: 班组
SQUAD.flavor:
Although individual pilots and other non-mechanized soldiers might not present much of a threat to most mechs, a squad of infantry with the right gear and training can be dangerous in their own right.
Squads are exactly what they sound like: small groups of five to ten armed and armored soldiers represented as one character on the battlefield.

SSC FLIGHT SYSTEM.name: SSC FLIGHT SYSTEM
SSC FLIGHT SYSTEM.effect: The Ace can fly whenever they move or Boost.

STINGER PISTOL.on_hit: Targets become Impaired until the end of their next turn.
STINGER PISTOL.name: STINGER PISTOL

STRAFE.name: STRAFE
STRAFE.effect: 1/round, as a quick action, the Ace can fly spaces equal to Speed in any direction, automatically dealing {3/4/6} Kinetic damage to one character below or adjacent to the path taken.

STRENGTH IN NUMBERS.name: STRENGTH IN NUMBERS
STRENGTH IN NUMBERS.effect: The Squad has Resistance to all damage from attacks that aren’t line, Cone, Burst or Blast , and is Immune to Grapple, Ram, Knockback, and Stunned.

STRIDER.name: 神行客
STRIDER.flavor: Striders are piloted by scouts, lone wolves, and mavericks - usually the kind of pilots who are accustomed to spending a lot of time behind enemy lines. The massive amount of gear these elite pilots bring with them gives them the ability to adapt to almost any circumstance.
STRIDER.tactics: The Strider is very flexible, but only effective at certain range bands. Use its abilities to reposition it so that it can make the most use out of its various kits. Players will find that moving around is a valuable strategy against the Strider, as being too close or too far for it to attack effectively can render it ineffective.

SUPERCHARGED.name: SUPERCHARGED
SUPERCHARGED.effect: Characters affected by Focus Down are also Shredded and Slowed until the end of their next turn.

Superfluous Extremities.name: Superfluous Extremities
Superfluous Extremities.effect: The Horror gains +1 Accuracy to Grapple and may perform Improvised Attack as a quick action.

SUPERHOT.name: SUPERHOT
SUPERHOT.effect: The Pyro gains Resistance to all damage from the attack. The attacker must pass an Engineering save or take {2/4/6} Burn.
SUPERHOT.trigger: The Pyro takes damage from a melee attack.

SUPERIOR CONSTRUCTION.name: SUPERIOR CONSTRUCTION
SUPERIOR CONSTRUCTION.effect: This trait replaces Resilient. The Ultra gains Resistance to one damage type – kinetic damage, Energy damage, or Explosive damage. They can’t gain permanent Resistance to more than two damage types, whether from this or any other system.

SUPERIOR FRAME.name: SUPERIOR FRAME
SUPERIOR FRAME.effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to Slowed, Shredded, and Immobilized.

SUPERIOR RAM.name: SUPERIOR RAM
SUPERIOR RAM.effect: When using Breach Ram the Breacher moves 4 more spaces, and targets have +1 Difficulty on the Agility save.

SUPERIOR REACTOR.name: SUPERIOR REACTOR
SUPERIOR REACTOR.effect: The Ultra gains Immunity to Stunned and Exposed.

SUPERIOR SENTINEL.name: SUPERIOR SENTINEL
SUPERIOR SENTINEL.effect: The Archer gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks made as reactions (e.g., Overwatch).

SUPPORT.tactics: Supports are bulky mechs that can’t deal any damage but have access to powerful healing and condition-clearing effects. Despite their resilience, they have no way to defend themselves and need to get close to their allies in order to be effective. Savvy players will shoot and destroy their Restock Drones before they are activated, denying an opportunity for healing.
SUPPORT.name: 支援者
SUPPORT.flavor: Support-archetype mechs keep their allies alive and operational with a broad library of immediate triage systems, from basic flash-weld plating through to shallow–medium structural reinforcement packs and whitewash nanite slurry. From the famed Laughter of a Solemn God, working the front lines of Boundary Garden’s battlefields, to the precision actions undertaken by the rogue-world hunters of ExtraSolar Acquisitions, Inc., the efficacy of Support-archetype mechs is unparalleled when mech teams need to stay alive longer than deployment.

SWAP KIT.effect:
The Strider swaps to one of their available kits, gaining new attack options. They also gain a bonus effect that can only be used this round. By default, they have two kits, MARKSMAN KIT and SKIRMISHER KIT, and can gain more with optional systems.
In any given turn, they can only use weapons and systems from one kit. When one of the Strider’s weapons or systems are destroyed, it must be chosen from their active kit.
The Strider starts combat with any kit of their choice, but does not get the swap bonus until they swap to a different kit.
SWAP KIT.name: SWAP KIT

SWIFT.name: SWIFT
SWIFT.effect: Once per round, the Monstrosity can Boost during its turn as a free action.

Symbiotic Doctrine Upgrade III.effect: The Leech’s speed is reduced by half. While Grappled to allied characters, the Leech can activate on its Grappled ally’s turn. The Leech cannot take turns more than once per round in this fashion unless granted additional activations by its equipped systems or traits.
Symbiotic Doctrine Upgrade III.name: Symbiotic Doctrine Upgrade III

SYSTEM FLAYER.name: SYSTEM FLAYER
SYSTEM FLAYER.effect: Characters that fail to save against Rebound Scan also receive Lock On and take {2/3/4} Heat.

Tank Shock.name: Tank Shock
Tank Shock.effect: The MBT ignores engagement and can pass through, but not stop in, spaces occupied by other characters and obstructions smaller than Size 3. The MBT destroys any objects it passes through this way, and if it passes through any characters, those characters are pushed out of the way as directly as possible if able. Passing through characters as part of a Boost also means those characters must, 1/turn, pass a Hull save or take {4/5/6} kinetic damage and be knocked Prone.

TEAR DOWN.name: TEAR DOWN
TEAR DOWN.effect: The Witch makes a tech attack against a character within Sensors. On a success, the target takes {1/2/3} heat immediately and then a further 4 Heat at the start of the Witch’s next turn.

TELEFRAG.name: TELEFRAG
TELEFRAG.effect: The Operator teleports into a space occupied by another character within line of sight and range 15. The target must succeed on an Agility save or take {4/8/12} AP Energy damage and become Jammed until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, they take half damage and aren’t Jammed. Succeed or fail, the Operator takes 1d6 AP Energy damage and is placed into a free space next to the target.

Tempest.name: Tempest
Tempest.flavor: The ascent to the top is met with trials that will break hearts and shatter bones. Spawned from the misty peaks of the Kimawense Range and from forgotten SecComm warminds, the Tempest, otherwise known as the Ebigane – a title found carved into its massive chassis when first discovered – casts its shadow over all those below. A massive nanite graywash–equipped flying platform intended to inflict localized changes to meteorological patterns, the Ebigane is an ancient mech pattern that predates Union’s mechanized chassis combat doctrines. It hovers above battlefields causing comprehensive weather anomalies intended to rout all hostile forces, soft or hard
Tempest.tactics: The Tempest hovers at the back of the enemy force, where it uses its weather-altering systems to wear down approaching forces. It manipulates area of effect conditions for both allies and hostiles using its Meteorological Graywash system. PCs and NPCs can seek cover from the oppressive weather effects by destroying climate nodes or seeking shelter within their stabilizing area of effect. That said, players should be wary. The Tempest is able to end Meteorological Graywashto deploy Nanite Meteor, which can be redirected to nodes for high damage. The Tempest is best in sitreps where the main goal is preventing hostiles from advancing or denying map zones. Its Nanite Typhoon Cannon can be used to threaten hostile holding zones and or to push enemies into meteor Blast areas. The Tempest comes with a host of optional systems that increase its versatility when interacting with climate nodes. When playing a Tempest, be sure to deploy it with NPCs that take attention away from it or assist it by providing forced movement or debilitating effects.

Terrifying.name: Terrifying
Terrifying.effect: Attacks against the Horror suffer +1 Difficulty if the attacker has line of sight to the target.

THUMPER GRENADES.name: THUMPER GRENADES
THUMPER GRENADES.effect:
The Spacer expends a charge for the following effect:
Thumper grenade (Grenade, range 5, Blast 1): Characters in the affected area must pass an Agility check or be knocked 3 spaces back, directly away from the center of the explosion. If this causes them to collide with an obstruction, they are also knocked Prone.

TITAN-SNARE DRONE.name: TITAN-SNARE DRONE
TITAN-SNARE DRONE.effect:
Snare Drone (Size 1/2, HP {5/10/15}, Evasion {10/12/14}, E-Defense {10/12/14}, Tags: Drone)
This drone can be printed and deployed to any free adjacent space. When hostile characters move into or start their turn within range 3 of the drone, it emits a pulse, and they become Immobilized until the drone is destroyed.

TRACE DRIVE.name: TRACE DRIVE
TRACE DRIVE.effect: The Operator teleports when they make their standard move.

TRAMPLE.name: TRAMPLE
TRAMPLE.effect: The Cataphract ignores engagement and can pass through – but not stop in – spaces occupied by other characters, 1/turn dealing {2/3/4} kinetic damage to those characters.

TRANSPORT.name: TRANSPORT
TRANSPORT.effect: The Ship can transport one Squad or characters whose combined Size is less than its own Size.

TRIPWIRES.name: TRIPWIRES
TRIPWIRES.effect: Lay Mines gains Recharge 5+. Mines deployed with Lay Mines now occupy a line3 area and detonate from the closest space when hostile characters move into or across the affected area.

TYPE.name: TYPE
TYPE.effect: The Vehicle can choose one or more options from the Vehicle Traits list.

ULTRA.name: 超体
ULTRA.description:
Ultras are the most dangerous individual foes a lancer might face on the battlefield – the champions, favored soldiers, chosen ones, and other mighty warriors of a fighting force. An Ultra might command a small retinue or lead an army from the front, but they are no grand strategists. Their primary tasks are always direct engagement with the enemy, holding or breaking lines, and ensuring through heroic efforts that their side wins the day.
Ultras are powerful enemies capable of taking on multiple mechs at once, along the lines of “boss” characters in video games. Like Elites, they have extra Structure, meaning they roll on the structure damage table and are much more resilient than most NPCs. Because they’re so much more powerful than regular NPCs (and keeping track of them is much more complex), it’s recommended you only use one Ultra in any given combat encounter.

ULTRA SYSTEMS AND TRAITS.name: ULTRA SYSTEMS AND TRAITS
ULTRA SYSTEMS AND TRAITS.effect: The Ultra chooses 1–3 options from the Ultra Systems and Traits list.

UMBRAL INTERDICTION.trigger: A character within Sensors and line of sight attempts an attack.
UMBRAL INTERDICTION.name: UMBRAL INTERDICTION
UMBRAL INTERDICTION.effect: The target must pass a Systems check or their attack automatically misses.

UMBRAL SHIFT.name: UMBRAL SHIFT
UMBRAL SHIFT.effect: The Lurker teleports to a SHROUD ZONE within line of sight.

UMBRAL SHROUD.name: UMBRAL SHROUD
UMBRAL SHROUD.effect:
At the start of any combat, when they arrive as reinforcements, or 1/round as a protocol, the Lurker can create a rippling storm of nanites – a SHROUD ZONE – in a free Blast 1 area within Range 5.
SHROUD ZONES provide soft cover. Additionally, while inside a SHROUD ZONE:
  • Lurkers (including this one) become INVISIBLE and gain RESISTANCE to all damage and heat.
  • Hostile characters are SHREDDED and IMPAIRED.

Shroud Zones can only be targeted by tech attacks and weapons that target E-DEFENSE (e.g., smart weapons). They have E-DEFENSE {10/13/16} and disperse upon any successful attack.
The Lurker can have no more than three SHROUD ZONES active at the same time. SHROUD ZONES can overlap each other, but their effects do not stack.

UNDERSIZE.name: UNDERSIZE
UNDERSIZE.effect: Individual soldiers can easily duck behind cover, but the sheer force of mech-scale weapons limits how effectively they can be shielded. The squad always has soft cover, even in the open, but can’t benefit from hard cover.

UNIQUE PHYSIOLOGY.name: UNIQUE PHYSIOLOGY
UNIQUE PHYSIOLOGY.effect:
If the Monstrosity has Structure (because it is an Elite or Ultra, for example), it rolls on the Monstrosity Structure Damage table when it takes structure damage.
Monstrosity Structure Damage Table
  • 5-6: Glancing Hit. The Monstrosity flinches in pain; it’s Impaired until the end of its next turn.
  • 3-4: Powerful Hit. The Monstrosity is knocked Prone by the force of the blow.
  • 2: Dismemberment. The attack blows a limb or chunk off the Monstrosity; it takes 1d6 Kinetic damage and becomes Slowed for the rest of the scene.
  • 1: Direct Hit. The result depends on the Monstrosity’s remaining Structure:
    • 3+ Structure: The Monstrosity is smacked in the head and Stunned until the end of its next turn.
    • 2 Structure: The Monstrosity must succeed on a Hull save or be destroyed.
    • 1 Structure: The Monstrosity is destroyed.
  • Multiple 1s: Fatal Hit. The Monstrosity is destroyed.

VIPER’S SPEED.name: VIPER’S SPEED
VIPER’S SPEED.effect: The Veteran always takes the first turn, even acting before PCs. Whenever there is a question about who acts first – in both narrative play and mech combat – it is always the Veteran. If multiple characters have this trait, only one gets to use it each time.

VOICE OF AUTHORITY.name: VOICE OF AUTHORITY
VOICE OF AUTHORITY.trigger: An allied character fails an attack, check or save, and the Commander isn’t Jammed.

VOID REND.name: VOID REND
VOID REND.effect:
This system creates a tear in reality in an adjacent free space that lasts until the end of the scene. The tear is not an object or character, does not provide obstruction, and cannot be interacted with in any way.

Characters that enter a space occupied by a tear may choose to leave realspace and enter a strange, gray, interstitial realm in which they can no longer see or interact with the real world. Characters that leave realspace in this way are removed from the battlefield entirely and cannot return for the remainder of the scene.

VOLLEY.name: VOLLEY
VOLLEY.effect: Pick characters in range 20 and line of sight. They take {4/6/8} Explosive damage, half if they pass an Agility save.

VULNERABLE TO TECH.name: VULNERABLE TO TECH
VULNERABLE TO TECH.effect: Hostile tech actions against the RPV gain +1 Accuracy.

WEAKNESS ANALYZER.effect: When the Specter starts the turn Hidden, their next attack (while Hidden) gains +{1/2/3} Accuracy and deals +1d6 Kinetic damage on a critical hit.
WEAKNESS ANALYZER.name: WEAKNESS ANALYZER

WEAK.name: WEAK
WEAK.effect: The Grunt can never have more than 1 Structure and 1 Stress, and they are immediately destroyed when they take heat from any source other than their own systems and weapons.

WEAVE.name: WEAVE
WEAVE.effect: Each round, the first attack made against the Hornet as a reaction automatically fails.

WINGED.name: WINGED
WINGED.effect: The Monstrosity may fly whenever it moves, and doesn’t need to land at the end of movements.

WITCH.name: 女巫
WITCH.flavor: Witch-archetype chassis can always be found in the eye of a systemic storm, where they are adept at generating realspace and legionspace terrors to blanket battlefields. At any given time, they are likely to be operating in both the physical battlefield and the tempest of the omninet. To handle the chaotic swirl of inputs and outputs that results from this split perception, Witches often pair with personality-clone NHPs, splitting tasks along parallel tracks to increase combat efficacy.
WITCH.tactics: Witches are no-nonsense controllers that use Tear Down to inflict heat and Blind to shut down ranged attackers. Predatory Logic gives them a tool to use against characters with heavy weapons, which can also aid their allies. Targets generally have an opportunity to mitigate their heat somewhat, since Witches deal most of their heat on their next turn.

“PAUSE” ENGINE.name: “PAUSE” ENGINE
“PAUSE” ENGINE.effect: The Bastion and one adjacent allied character are temporarily shielded by a flickering pane of portable blinkspace, gaining Immunity to all damage and effects until the start of the Bastion’s next turn. The allied character loses Immunity if it breaks adjacency. At the start of their Bastion’s next turn, they become Stunned until the start of their following turn.

Abominable.name: 恶质
Abominable.effect: 扫描不显示任何怖物相关信息，除是个怖物外。

Abhorrent Redundancies.name: 憎恶冗余
Abhorrent Redundancies.effect: 怖物 HP 降低为 0 时可掷骰 1d6。5+则 HP 恢复至 1 并获得 3/4/5 护盾。该特征在第一次触发后可在结果 6+时再次触发。

ABJURE.name: 誓绝
ABJURE.effect: 司铎对感应内一个目标进行科技攻击。成功则对方每次攻击都受到 2/3/4 热度直到对方下一回合结束。

ABLATIVE SHIELDING.name: 烧蚀保护层
ABLATIVE SHIELDING.effect: 清扫器对能量伤害具有抗性。

ACE.name: 王牌
ACE.flavor: 首位展现王牌原型机魅力的角色是艾斯琳·詹森（Aisling Jensen），她是维丹娜（Verdana）解放运动期间活跃的一名辅助飞军驾驶员。作为底盘和苍穹之骑士，像艾斯琳这样的王牌以高速扫射、敏捷机动和不顾一切的大胆壮举将他们的机甲投入战斗。他们骄傲自信，热衷于一场精彩的决斗。
ACE.tactics: 王牌是高机动快反应的突击，可以使用桶滚来减轻危险或高伤害攻击。桶滚对重型武器尤为有效。他们的引导武器无视掩体，也不需要视线，因此可以持续造成伤害。相对较低的 HP 使得王牌容易受到持续伤害，且他们在对付科技攻击时相对较弱。

ACROBAT.name: 杂技演员
ACROBAT.effect: 老兵移动或推进后可飞行 3 空间。该飞行无视交战和反应。

ACID SPITTLE.name: 酸液喷吐
ACID SPITTLE.on_hit: 目标离散直到对方下一回合结束。

Active Camo.name: 主动迷彩
Active Camo.effect:
以一个协定，特种部队可消耗 1 充能隐形直到他们下一回合结束。
此效果持续期间，特种部队下一次近战或远程攻击若命中则视为会心一击。

ADVANCED KIT.name: 先进元件
ADVANCED KIT.effect: 超体从职业中选择 1~2 个额外可选系统。

AMBUSHERS.name: 伏击者
AMBUSHERS.effect: 班组在首轮战斗中所有攻击、豁免和检定+2 准度。

Anti-Tank Gun.name: 反坦克炮
Anti-Tank Gun.effect: 会心一击：目标离散直到其下一回合结束。

ARCHER.name: 弓箭手
ARCHER.flavor: 弓箭手原型为大熊座公司（Ursa Major）的护门者之匙二型（Gatekeeper Key-II），因伊卡伯德·卡登（Ichabod Carden）在地震动（Terramoto）战役中的英勇行为而广为人知。弓箭手原型机为强大的瞄准和叠加边界机动系统而牺牲装甲，这让它们深受热爱控制每次射击精确目标的驾驶员青睐。
ARCHER.tactics: 弓箭手擅长于对敌人施加“选择惩罚”——他们让角色在采取某些行动或让弓箭手攻击他们之间做出选择。使用弓箭手锁定高机动或强攻击的 PC，或掩护更脆弱的盟友。记住，当弓箭手能够相当接近他们的目标时最为有效，但他们并不特别坚固。

Armaments.name: 武装配备
Armaments.effect: 主战坦克必须选择一门主炮和一件辅助武器。

Armament Loadout.name: 武装配备
Armament Loadout.effect: 主战坦克必须选择一门主炮和一件辅助武器。

ASSASSIN.tactics: 暗杀者是重击落单角色的真正专家。使用暗杀者标记选择一个目标，然后充分利用暗杀者的高速和轻跃来接近距离。有个相当具有威胁的的组合，将暗杀者与会造成机动性降低状态如昏迷或伏卧的 NPC 配对。若没有“魔鬼的咳嗽”霰弹枪这样的可选系统，暗杀者便只能进行近战攻击，且很容易受到持续伤害。
ASSASSIN.name: 暗杀者
ASSASSIN.flavor: 暗杀者型机甲倾向于敏捷，高伤和速度。这些驾驶员为提高效率而牺牲舒适性，从拆除生命维持到通讯系统，取而代之更强大的处理能力和潜行能力。暗杀者可单打独斗，也可组队作战，驾驶着他们小巧优美的机甲穿过几乎无法穿越的地形，在毫无防备情况下逮住目标。

ASSAULT.name: 突击手
ASSAULT.flavor: 突击手机甲是银河系中最为常见的主要战斗骨架。配备重型步枪、随身武器和一套增强移动、瞄准和防御能力的系统，它们是直接可靠坚韧英勇的战斗单位。突击手机甲驾驶员的训练和装备也是最为价格低廉的，但这并不会妨碍其危险性。
ASSAULT.tactics: 突击手是直接了当造成伤害的突击。把他们安置在一个可以有效利用他们韧性和适当射程的位置，使用受身抵抗伤害以最大限度提高他们的生存能力。

Assimilation Maw.name: 同化虚洞
Assimilation Maw.effect: 此外，若怖物用此武器摧毁另一个角色无论敌我，或命中残骸，则恢复 10/15/20 HP。残骸和盟友自动被该武器命中。受此武器攻击的残骸自动摧毁。
Assimilation Maw.on_hit: 若目标在攻击结束后只有一半或更少的 HP，必须通过机体豁免否则将 HP 降为 0。

ATLAS MISSILES.name: 阿特拉斯导弹
ATLAS MISSILES.effect: 祈雨师选择视线射程 30 内一个地面空间，所有角色都知悉选择了哪些空间。祈雨师发射一枚导弹，在下一轮结束时该地点造成溅射 2 的爆炸；受影响角色受到16/20/24 爆炸伤害，成功进行敏捷豁免伤害减半。

AVENGER.name: 复仇者
AVENGER.flavor: 复仇者级机甲的驾驶员往往是狂热者、职业战士，以及来自高度重视禁卫军或战士种姓文化的民族。战斗中，这些驾驶员扮演着力量倍增者和班组领导者的角色，但比起他们的机甲，他们作为个人更引人注目。复仇者驾驶员与他们的盟友紧密维系着——这份牵绊强大到当形势转向对敌人有利时，对战斗、失败和斗争的强烈情绪足以促使他们做出令人难以置信的英雄壮举。
AVENGER.tactics: 复仇者最初并不是特别危险，但当他们的盟友们集结在他周围时，便是他们极具危险之时。将它们安置在其他高优先级目标附近，以利用它们的复仇能力，迫使角色在首先消灭它们或因摧毁盟友而遭受更多痛苦之间做出选择。

A Wicked Mess.name: 邪恶扰乱
A Wicked Mess.effect: 水蛭擒拿一个敌对角色时，每当水蛭受到伤害，该角色受到 2AP 能量伤害和 2 热度。

BARREL ROLL.name: 桶滚
BARREL ROLL.effect: 王牌执行桶滚，向任意方向飞行 6 空间并使攻击未命中。该移动忽略交战和反应。
BARREL ROLL.trigger: 近战或远程攻击命中王牌。

BASTION.name: 棱堡
